references.paper_title: The facial action coding system: A technique for the measurement of facial movement
references.reason: It is foundational for the field, defining the Facial Action Coding System (FACS), which the current paper builds upon for facial expression analysis and editing.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is fundamental to the current paper's use of text-to-image generation and conditioning for the Stable Diffusion model.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Diffusion, the core architecture that the current paper adapts and extends for facial expression editing.

references.paper_title: Adding conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: ControlNet, presented here, is crucial as it provides the framework for adding additional controls to the Stable Diffusion model, which is leveraged in the current work.

references.paper_title: Deep affect prediction in-the-wild: Aff-wild database and challenge, deep architectures, and beyond
references.reason: The Aff-Wild dataset, introduced in this paper, is the primary dataset used for training the model in the current work, thus shaping its capabilities and performance.
